page.title: 06ECOLOGY: DANE END & AREA
page.content: {WILD FLOWERS:}There is a large patch of rare{green hellebore}in one of the woods in the area but few people know exactly where it is. Cowslips, primroses and violets grow on the steep banks and verges of the country roads in Springtime. The woods are bright with bluebells and in summer yellow archangels flourish. The monkey orchid can sometimes be found. In July, there are enormous patches of scarlet poppies in the fields. {MAMMALS:}There is evidence of many common mammals such as badgers, foxes, rabbits, hares, mice, rats, grey squirrels, weasels, stoats and moles and several species of deer can be seen grazing on the edge of woodland. {BIRDS:}Fieldfare and lapwings can be seen in the fields and kestrels hover searching for prey. Yellowhammers add a splash of gold to the hedgerows.
